com.lightbend.lagom.javadsl.api.deser

Interface IdSerializer<Id>

  • Type Parameters:
    Id - The type of the ID.

    public interface IdSerializer<Id>
    An ID serializer is responsible for serializing and deserializing IDs from URL paths. A path is specified in the framework using a String like /blog/:blogId/post/:postId. The blogId and postId parts of the path are extracted, and passed in order in a list of parameters to the IdSerializer. When creating a path, the IdSerializer takes the id object, and turns it back into a list of path parameters.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Id deserialize(RawId rawId)
      Deserialize the rawId into an ID.
      default java.util.Optional<Integer> numPathParamsHint()
      A hint of the number of path parameters that this id serializer serializes.
      RawId serialize(Id id)
      Serialize the given id into a list of path parameters.

    • Method Detail

      • serialize

        RawId serialize(Id id)
        Serialize the given id into a list of path parameters.
        Parameters:
        id - The id to serialize.
        Returns:
        The RawId.

      • deserialize

        Id deserialize(RawId rawId)
        Deserialize the rawId into an ID.
        Returns:
        The deserialized ID.

      • numPathParamsHint

        default java.util.Optional<Integer> numPathParamsHint()
        A hint of the number of path parameters that this id serializer serializes. This is used by id serializers that compose with other ID serializers, so that a parent serializer can know how many parameters its children extract, that way it can modify the raw ID it passes to them in order for them to deserialize just the part of the ID that they are interested in. If this returns empty, it means this ID serializer cannot be composed with other IdSerializers that extract path parameters.
        Returns:
        The number of path parameters that this ID serializer extracts.
